Description:
Job Description-We are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Payable Accountant to join our finance team. As a Payable Accountant, you will be responsible for managing the accounts payable process, ensuring accurate and timely payments to vendors and suppliers.Responsibilities:Charge expenses to accounts and cost centers and control petty cash spending.
Verify vendor accounts, pay vendors, and resolve purchase issues, invoices, or payment discrepancies.
Monitor payroll expense claims, including salary advances and overtime payments.
Reconcile account transactions with the general ledger.
Perform recordkeeping and prepare financial reports.
Oversee the daily operations of the accounts payable department, managing workflows, and ensuring accuracy and timeliness of payments.
Monitor accounts and ensure that any discrepancies are identified and resolved.
Prepare monthly and annual reports for management.
Support for the preparation of the annual audit.Skills
Skills: Your expertise in financial management, attention to detail, and strong analytical skills will be crucial in maintaining the accuracy of our financial records and supporting our organization's financial stability.

Demonstrates advanced understanding of financial accounting, reporting, planning, controlling, assurance, internal control, treasury, or investment a strong plus.
Exhibits a strong grasp of financial knowledge, that involves financial accounting, reporting, planning, treasury, and investment.
Complete mastery of general ledger functions to track all financial transactions within an organization.
Expertise in financial accounting, reporting, planning, controlling, assurance, and investment.

Proven work experience as an Accounts Payable Specialist or similar role.
Advanced competency in accounting and business management software/ERPs.
In-depth knowledge of accounts payable principles, accounting standards, and industry regulations.
Excellent collaboration and communication abilities.
Extensive experience in account reconciliation.

At least 5 years experience in handling accounts payable in a multi-national company
Bachelorâ€™s degree in accounting & finance or higher education.
Professional qualifications will be preferred.
